snippet: African peacekeepers trying to stabilize the Central African Republic said they had regained control of a town where hundreds of heavily armed rebels had massed.
abstract: African peacekeepers in Central African Republic regain control of town of Sibut, where hundreds of armed rebels had massed.
lead_paragraph: African peacekeepers trying to stabilize the Central African Republic said they had regained control of a town where hundreds of heavily armed rebels had massed.

headline.main: Town Is Secured in Central Africa
headline.print_headline: Town Is Secured In Central Africa
